intro: Dahlia calzadana, commonly known as the Mexican dahlia, is a tuberous-rooted herbaceous perennial native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, single or double flowers in a wide range of colors. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters, with narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. Its flowers are borne on tall, sturdy stems and bloom from late summer into early autumn. The tuberous roots are used for propagation and are an important part of its botanical structure.
